The looting cost the rebel fighters much popular support.{{cite web|title=Syrian rebels sidetracked by scramble for spoils of war|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2012/dec/27/syrian-rebels-scramble-spoils-war|publisher=The Guardian|accessdate=27 September 2015}} Islamic extremists and foreign fighters, many of whom were experienced and came from the ongoing insurgency in neighboring Iraq, joined the battle. Jihadists reportedly came from across the Muslim world. Jacques Bérès, a French surgeon who treated wounded fighters, reported a significant number of foreign fighters, most of whom had Islamist goals and were not directly interested in Bashar al-Assad. They included Libyans, Chechens, and Frenchmen. Bérès contrasted the situation in Aleppo with that in [[Idlib]] and [[Homs]], where foreign forces were not common.{{cite news|title=Jihadists join Aleppo fight, eye Islamic state, surgeon says |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/09/08/us-syria-crisis-jihad-idUSBRE88708W20120908|date=8 September 2012 |accessdate=9 September 2012|work=Reuters}} Some FSA brigades cooperated with Mujahideen fighters. Four hundred Turkmen joined the battle under Sultan Abdulhamid Han.{{cite news|title=Syrian Turkmen fighting for better future |url=http://www.timeturk.com/en/2012/08/24/syrian-turkmen-fighting-for-better-future.html |publisher=TimeTurk |date=24 August 2012 |accessdate=10 September 2012}} By 2016, the rebel factions still included internationally recognized terrorist groups such as [[Al-Nusra Front]]; they numbered 1,000 fighters in October 2016. [[File:Blown out tank Aleppo.jpg|thumb|left|A destroyed government tank on a road in Aleppo]] [[Hezbollah]], which by 2013 joined the Syrian Civil War in support for President al-Assad, was also designated as a terrorist group by various organizations.{{cite web|title=Arab League brands Hezbollah a terrorist organisation|publisher=BBC News|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-35789303|date=11 March 2016|accessdate=25 December 2016}} The government retained some support in Aleppo; in 2012 a rebel commander said, "around 70% of Aleppo city is with the regime".{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2012/aug/21/syrian-rebels-aleppo-local-hostility|title=Syrian rebels fight on for Aleppo despite local wariness|first=Martin|last=Chulov|date=21 August 2012|publisher=|via=The Guardian}} During the course of the battle, Assad lost support from Aleppo's wealthy class.{{cite web|url=http://www.thedailybeast.com/articles/2012/09/01/bashar-al-assad-lost-the-support-of-aleppo-s-wealthy-when-the-shelling-started.html |title=Bashar al-Assad Lost The Support of Aleppo's Wealthy When the Shelling Started |publisher=The Daily Beast |date=1 September 2012 |accessdate=8 October 2012}} In 2012, [[CBS News]] reported that 48 elite businessmen who were the primary financiers for the government switched sides.{{cite news|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-503543_162-57499071-503543/assads-aleppo-backers-abandon-him-some-shift-support-cash-to-rebels-in-risky-gamble/ |title=Assad's Aleppo backers abandon him, some shift support, cash to rebels in risky gamble|publisher=CBS News |date=23 August 2012 |accessdate=8 October 2012}} For the first time, the government's [[Syrian Arab Army]] engaged in [[urban warfare]]. They divided their forces into groups of 40 soldiers each. These were armed mostly with automatic rifles and anti-tank rockets and artillery, tanks and helicopters were only used for support. In August 2012, the army deployed its elite units.{{cite news|title=Assad's man directs battle for Aleppo |url=http://www.theaustralian.com.au/news/world/assads-man-directs-battle-for-aleppo/story-e6frg6so-1226466759906 |work=The Australian |date=7 September 2012 |accessdate=10 September 2012}} and eventually, after the rebels executed Zeino al-Berri, tribal leader of the [[al-Berri tribe]], the tribe joined the fight against the rebels.{{cite news|title=Syria rebels to target intel, as Assad hails army |url=http://www.dailystar.com.lb/News/Middle-East/2012/Aug-01/183024-syria-rebels-to-target-intel-as-assad-hails-army.ashx#axzz22JS4jWNB |last=Kat |first=Iskander |date=1 August 2012 |accessdate=9 September 2012}} Initially, the Christian community tried to avoid taking sides in the conflict. However, many Christians supported the Army and some formed militias aligned with the government following the capture of their quarters by the Syrian Army. Many Christian Armenians also supported the Syrian Army. Some of Aleppo's Armenians claimed Turkey supported the FSA to attack Armenians and Arab Christians.{{citation needed|date=February 2018}} In 2012, one Armenian militia had around 150 fighters. At the beginning of the battle, Aleppo's Kurds formed armed groups, most notably the [[Saladin Ayubi Brigade]], which worked with the opposition. Units of the [[Kurdish Front]], part of the FSA and allied with the [[Democratic Union Party (Syria)|Democratic Union Party]] (PYD), were formed later in 2013. The PYD had poor relations with both sides. Its [[People's Protection Units]] (YPG) stayed out of Arab areas and insisted the FSA stay out of the Kurdish area. They did not initially fight the Syrian Army unless attacked.{{cite news|title=Cold PKK-FSA Truce in Syria|url=http://www.rudaw.net/english/science/columnists/5063.html|last=Van Wilgenburg|first=Wladimir|publisher=Rudaw|date=8 August 2012|accessdate=9 September 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120911232257/http://www.rudaw.net/english/science/columnists/5063.html|archivedate=11 September 2012}} The Kurdish areas in Aleppo mainly came under PYD control.{{cite web|first=Fehim|last=Taştekin|title=Turkey Pulse: Kurds eye new corridor to Mediterranean|url=http://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/originals/2015/06/turkey-syria-kurdish-corridor-in-the-making-kobane.html|publisher=Al Monitor|date=22 June 2015|accessdate=26 January 2017}} At various points in the conflict, the Kurds joined the opposition against pro-government forces. However, the YPG-controlled neighborhood of [[Sheikh Maqsood]] came under a siege by both Syrian government forces and the rebels. In September 2015, the rebels accused the YPG of having a deal with the government, while the YPG accused the rebels of shelling the neighborhood.{{cite web |url= http://syriadirect.org/news/victory-army-and-ypg-trade-accusations-over-sheikh-maqsoud-crossing/|title= Victory Army and YPG trade accusations over Sheikh Maqsoud crossing|date= 30 September 2015|publisher= Syria:direct}} Between November and December 2015, the conflict between the rebels and US-backed Kurdish-led [[Syrian Democratic Forces]] (SDF) in the rest of Aleppo province escalated.{{cite web |url= http://www.middleeasteye.net/news/ypg-and-allies-clashes-syrian-opposition-groups-aleppo-633986086|title= YPG, allies clash with Syrian opposition groups in Aleppo|date= 29 November 2015|publisher= Middle East Eye}}{{cite web |url= https://now.mmedia.me/lb/en/NewsReports/566318-kurds-in-northwest-syria-declare-state-of-emergency|title= Kurds in northwest Syria declare state of emergency|date= 2 December 2015|publisher= Now}} Truce attempts largely failed to stop the fighting.{{cite web |url= http://eaworldview.com/2015/12/syria-daily-free-syrian-army-kurds-sign-truce-in-aleppo-province/|title= Syria Daily, Dec 4: Free Syrian Army & Kurds Sign Truce in Aleppo Province|date= 4 December 2015|publisher= EA Earthview}}{{cite tweet |user= ALAMAWI|number= 678206891386884096|date= 19 December 2015|title= The Army of Rebels joined the Mare' Operations Room!!}} The situation escalated in February 2016, when the SDF followed up on advances by the Syrian Armed Forces, backed by [[Russian military intervention in the Syrian Civil War|Russian airstrikes]], and they themselves took territory north of Aleppo city from the rebels.{{cite web |url= https://now.mmedia.me/lb/en/NewsReports/566572-syria-kurds-advance-in-north-aleppo-following-regime-victory|title= Syria Kurds advance in north Aleppo following regime victory|date= 4 February 2016|publisher= Now}}{{cite web |url= https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/middleeast/syria/12151367/Syrian-air-base-seized-by-Kurds-and-their-allies.html|title= Syrian air base 'seized by Kurds and their allies'|date= 11 February 2016|publisher= The Telegraph}} Starting in late September 2015, [[Russian Air Force|Russian warplanes]] had carried out their very first attacks in Syria.{{cite web|last1=N/A|first1=N/A|title=Russia joins war in Syria: Five key points|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-34416519|website=British Broadcasting Channel|publisher=BBC|accessdate=12 April 2016}} The Russian bombing campaign included strikes against rebel forces in Aleppo.{{cite web|last1=Starr|first1=Barbara|last2=Labott|first2=Elise|title=Aleppo teeters but no sign of US action|url=http://www.cnn.com/2016/09/28/politics/us-aleppo-russia-syria-options/|website=CNN Politics|publisher=CNN|date=28 September 2016|accessdate=12 May 2016}} == Course of the battle == === 2012: Initial rebel attack and capture of Eastern Aleppo === {{main|Combat operations in 2012 during the Battle of Aleppo}} Gunfire between rebels and security forces broke out in and around [[Salaheddine District|Salaheddine]], a district in the city's southwest, on the night of 19 July 2012.{{cite web |url=http://www.dailystar.com.lb/News/Middle-East/2012/Jul-20/181348-fierce-fighting-in-syrias-aleppo-ngo.ashx#axzz21EXLhUyc |title=Fierce fighting in Syria's Aleppo:activists |date=20 July 2012 |work=The Daily Star |accessdate=29 July 2012}} In late July and early August 2012, the FSA continued its offensive in Aleppo, with both sides suffering a high level of casualties. Rebel commanders said their main aim was to capture the city center.{{cite news|last=Solomon |first=Erika |url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2012/07/31/uk-syria-crisis-idUKBRE86H18C20120731 |title=Syrian army pounds Aleppo, rebels claim successes |publisher=Reuters |date=31 July 2012|accessdate=2 November 2012}} On 30 July, the rebels [[Battle of Anadan|seized a strategic checkpoint in Anadan]], a town north of Aleppo, gaining a direct route between the city and the Turkish border—an important rebel supply base.{{cite web|url=http://blogs.aljazeera.com/topic/syria/syrian-rebels-seize-strategic-checkpoint-between-aleppo-and-turkey-according-rebel|title=Syrian rebels seize strategic checkpoint between Aleppo and Turkey, according to rebel officer|publisher=Al Jazeera|agency=AFP|date=30 July 2012|accessdate=29 July 2012|dead-url=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120730092014/http://blogs.aljazeera.com/topic/syria/syrian-rebels-seize-strategic-checkpoint-between-aleppo-and-turkey-according-rebel|archivedate=30 July 2012}} They also captured [[Al-Bab]], an army base northeast of the city.{{cite news |url=http://www.aljazeera.com/video/middleeast/2012/07/201273154349545922.html|title=Rebels claim victory in Syria's al-Bab town|date=31 July 2012 |work=Al Jazeera |accessdate=31 July 2012}} Later, rebels attacked the air base at Minakh, {{Convert|30|km|miles|abbr=on}} northwest of Aleppo, with arms and tanks captured at the Anadan checkpoint.{{cite web|url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/Todays-News-1-124473-Rebels-use-tanks-to-attack-air-base |title=Rebels use tanks to attack air base |publisher=The News |date= |accessdate=2 November 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120805025858/http://www.thenews.com.pk/Todays-News-1-124473-Rebels-use-tanks-to-attack-air-base |archivedate=5 August 2012 }} Opposition forces continued to gain territory in the city, controlling most of eastern and southwestern Aleppo, including Salaheddine and parts of Hamdaniyeh.{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/ambushes-and-air-strikes-as-syrian-regime-fight-rebels-streetbystreet-to-gain-possession-of-aleppo-7994450.html |title=Ambushes and air strikes as Syrian regime fight rebels street-by-street to gain possession of Aleppo |author=Kim Sengupta |date=31 July 2012 |work=The Independent |accessdate=31 July 2012 |location=London}} They continued to target security centers and police stations as clashes erupted near the Air Force intelligence headquarters in Aleppo's northwestern district [[Al-Zahraa|Zahraa]].{{cite news|url=http://blogs.aljazeera.com/topic/syria/syrian-forces-blast-rebel-held-districts-aleppo-according-activists|title=Syrian forces blast rebel-held districts of Aleppo, according to activists|publisher=Al Jazeera|agency=AFP|date=30 July 2012|accessdate=29 July 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120731024950/http://blogs.aljazeera.com/topic/syria/syrian-forces-blast-rebel-held-districts-aleppo-according-activists|archivedate=31 July 2012}} Rebels over-ran several police stations and posts in the central and southern districts of Bab al-Nerab, Al-Miersa and Salhain, seizing a significant quantity of arms and ammunition. File:FSA rebels hold a planning session.jpg|[[Free Syrian Army]] rebels hold a planning session File:Bombed out vehicles Aleppo.jpg|Bombed out vehicles in Aleppo File:Conquest Brigade fights in Al-Midan neighborhood in Aleppo.webm|[[Conquest Brigade]] fighters battle government forces in [[al-Midan]], September 2012 === 2013: Advances and counter-advances === {{main|Combat operations in 2013 during the Battle of Aleppo}} [[File:ISIL car bomb explodes in Menagh Air Base.gif|left|thumb|An [[ISIL]] [[suicide attack|suicide bomber]] detonates a [[car bomb]] during the [[Siege of Menagh Air Base]].]] In December 2012, the [[al-Nusra Front]] unilaterally declared a [[no-fly zone]] and threatened to shoot down commercial aircraft, alleging that the government was using them to transport loyalist troops and military supplies.{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2012/12/201212221532021654.html |title=Syria 'secures chemical weapons stockpile', |publisher=Aljazeera.com |date= |accessdate=29 August 2013}} After multiple attacks on Aleppo International Airport, all flights were suspended on 1 January 2013.{{cite web|title=Syria: Fighting In Aleppo Continues Between Assad Forces And Rebels Near Supply Road, Historic Mosque|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/02/27/syria-fighting-in-aleppo_n_2772964.html?ir=India&adsSiteOverride=in|publisher=Huffington Post|accessdate=25 July 2015}} The following month, the rebels seized [[Great Mosque of Aleppo|Umayyad Mosque]]; and during the battle, the mosque's museum caught fire and its ceiling collapsed.{{cite web|title=Umayyad Mosque In Aleppo Seized By Syria Rebels (VIDEO)|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/02/28/umayyad-mosque-aleppo-seized-syria-rebels_n_2781231.html?ir=India&adsSiteOverride=in|publisher=Huffington Post|accessdate=25 July 2015}} On 9 June, the Syrian Army announced the start of "[[Aleppo offensive (October–December 2013)|Operation Northern Storm]]", an attempt to recapture territory in and around the city.{{cite web|title=Syria: Assad forces massing for major assault on Aleppo|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/middleeast/syria/10109013/Syria-Assad-forces-massing-for-major-assault-on-Aleppo.html|publisher=Telegraph|accessdate=25 July 2015}} Between 7 and 14 June, army troops, government militiamen and [[Hezbollah]] fighters launched the operation. Over a one-week period, government forces advanced in the city and the countryside, pushing back the rebels. However, according to an opposition activist, on 14 June the situation started reversing after rebels halted an armored reinforcement column from Aleppo that was heading for two Shiite villages northwest of the city.{{cite web|title=Rebel brigades check loyalist advances in Aleppo: opposition|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2013/06/16/us-syria-crisis-aleppo-idUSBRE95F0BA20130616|publisher=Reuters|accessdate=25 July 2015}} On 8 November, the Syrian Army started an offensive against the rebel-held Base 80, launching "the heaviest barrage in more than a year".{{cite web|title=Syria troops launch major offensive in Aleppo|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2013/11/syria-troops-launch-major-offensive-aleppo-201311863542920283.html|publisher=Al Jazeera|accessdate=23 September 2015}} ''[[Al Jazeera]]'' wrote that a government victory would cut the rebels' route between the city and al-Bab.{{cite web|title=Backed by tanks and artillery|url=http://live.aljazeera.com/Event/Syria_Live_Blog/95575090|publisher=Al Jazeera|accessdate=26 July 2015}} Two days later, [[Reuters]] reported that the rebels had regrouped to fight the Syrian army.{{cite web|title=Syrian army closes in on Aleppo after dawn attack|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2013/11/08/us-syria-crisis-aleppo-idUSBRE9A70JN20131108|publisher=Reuters|accessdate=26 July 2015}} Fifteen rebels were killed and the army recaptured the base.{{cite web|title=Syria army retakes parts of base by Aleppo airport: NGO|url=http://www.business-standard.com/article/pti-stories/syria-army-retakes-parts-of-base-by-aleppo-airport-ngo-113110800979_1.html|publisher=Business Standard|accessdate=26 July 2015}} The following month, the army partially besieged the city in [[Operation Canopus Star]].{{cite web|title=Syrian army to impose blockade in Aleppo|url=http://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/security/2014/03/syria-army-impose-blockade-militants-aleppo.html#|publisher=Al Monitor|accessdate=26 July 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150713202354/http://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/security/2014/03/syria-army-impose-blockade-militants-aleppo.html|archive-date=13 July 2015|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} During the offensive, Army helicopters attacked with [[barrel bomb]]s, killing more than a thousand people, according to the Free Syrian Army's Abu Firas Al-Halabi.{{cite web|title=Syria: Intense Aleppo offensive prompts mass exodus|url=http://www.aawsat.net/2013/12/article55325898|publisher=Aawsat|accessdate=26 July 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150128061147/http://www.aawsat.net/2013/12/article55325898|archivedate=28 January 2015|df=dmy-all}} === 2014: Syrian government encirclement of the rebels === {{main|Combat operations in 2014 during the Battle of Aleppo}} Government forces, having lifted the siege of Aleppo in October 2013, continued their offensive in 2014. This culminated in the capture of the Sheikh Najjar industrial district north of Aleppo and the lifting of the siege of Aleppo Central Prison on 22 May 2014, which contained a garrison of government soldiers that had resisted rebel forces since 2012.{{cite web|url=http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/syria-army-breaks-rebel-siege-of-aleppo-central-prison-ngo.aspx?pageID=238&nID=66804&NewsCatID=352|title=Syria army breaks rebel siege of Aleppo central prison: NGO|publisher=|accessdate=23 September 2015}} A [[ceasefire]] proposal was presented by a [[United Nations|UN]] envoy in November; under the proposal humanitarian aid would be delivered to Aleppo following the cessation of hostilities. President Assad said the ceasefire plan was "worth studying",{{cite web|url=https://www.thestar.com/news/world/2014/11/10/aleppo_ceasefire_worth_studying_says_assad.html|title=Aleppo ceasefire 'worth studying,' says Assad - Toronto Star|website=thestar.com}} and according to the UN envoy the Syrian government was "seriously studying" the proposal.{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2014/11/syria-seriously-studying-un-truce-proposal-2014111118514613822.html|title=Syria 'seriously studying' UN truce proposal|website=www.aljazeera.com}} The FSA rejected the plan; its military commander Zaher al-Saket said they had "learned not to trust the [Bashar al-] Assad regime because they are cunning and only want to buy time".{{cite web|title=Syrian rebels reject UN's Aleppo truce plan|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2014/11/syrian-rebels-rejects-un-aleppo-truce-plan-20141112172139629558.html|publisher=Al Jazeera|accessdate=30 July 2015}} === 2015: War of attrition === {{main|Combat operations in 2015 during the Battle of Aleppo}} {{See also|Aleppo offensive (October–December 2015)|East Aleppo offensive (2015–16)}} [[File:Aleppians waiting in a bread line during the Syrian civil war.jpg|thumb|left|Aleppians waiting in a bread line during the Syrian civil war]] In early January, the rebels recaptured the Majbal (sawmills) area of al-Brej and captured the southern entrance of the stone quarries known as al-Misat, forcing government troops to retreat to the north.{{cite web|url=http://syriahr.com/en/2015/01/20-soldiers-in-regime-forces-killed-during-clashes-in-al-brej-area/ |title=20 soldiers in regime forces killed during clashes in al-Brej area |author=Master |work=Syrian Observatory For Human Rights |accessdate=16 February 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150202045023/http://syriahr.com/en/2015/01/20-soldiers-in-regime-forces-killed-during-clashes-in-al-brej-area/ |archivedate=2 February 2015 }} Rebels also seized the Manasher al-Brej area. They tried to advance and take control of al-Brej Hill, with which they could seize the military supply road running between Aleppo Central Prison and the Handarat and al-Mallah areas.{{cite web|url=http://syriahr.com/en/2015/01/al-jabha-al-islameyyi-and-jaysho-al-muhajereen-wal-al-anasar-seize-manasher-al-brej-area/ |title=Al- Jabha al- Islameyyi and Jaysho al- Muhajereen wal al- Anasar seize Manasher al- Brej area |author=sohranas |work=Syrian Observatory For Human Rights |accessdate=16 February 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150128060654/http://syriahr.com/en/2015/01/al-jabha-al-islameyyi-and-jaysho-al-muhajereen-wal-al-anasar-seize-manasher-al-brej-area/ |archivedate=28 January 2015 }} At the end of January, the rebels took control over some positions in al-Brej Hill.{{cite web|url=http://syriahr.com/en/2015/01/6-citizens-killed-in-al-bab-and-members-on-both-the-islamic-battalions-and-regime-forces-die-in-aleppo-clashes/ |title=6 citizens killed in al- Bab, and members on both the Islamic battalions and regime forces die in Aleppo clashes |author=sohranas |work=Syrian Observatory For Human Rights |accessdate=16 February 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150128112355/http://syriahr.com/en/2015/01/6-citizens-killed-in-al-bab-and-members-on-both-the-islamic-battalions-and-regime-forces-die-in-aleppo-clashes/ |archivedate=28 January 2015 }}{{cite web|url=http://syriahr.com/en/2015/01/violent-clashes-around-aleppo-and-its-countryside/ |title=Violent clashes around Aleppo and its countryside |author=Master |work=Syrian Observatory For Human Rights |accessdate=16 February 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150128060700/http://syriahr.com/en/2015/01/violent-clashes-around-aleppo-and-its-countryside/ |archivedate=28 January 2015 }} In mid-February, the Syrian Arab Army and its allies launched a major offensive in the northern Aleppo countryside, with the aim of cutting the last rebel supply routes into the city, and relieving the rebel siege of the Shi'a-majority towns Zahra'a and Nubl to the northwest of Aleppo.{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/afp/article-2957032/Syria-regime-forces-launch-new-Aleppo-offensive.html|title=Syria regime forces launch new Aleppo offensive|work=Mail Online|accessdate=18 March 2015}} They quickly captured several villages,{{cite news|url=http://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/syrian-rebels-regain-area-lost-city-aleppo-29043678|title=Fierce Fighting Near Aleppo as UN Envoy Pushes Truce in City |agency=Associated Press|accessdate=18 February 2015}} but bad weather conditions and an inability to call up reinforcements stalled the government offensive.{{cite news|url= http://www.dailystar.com.lb/News/Middle-East/2015/Feb-19/288012-rebels-capture-32-pro-government-forces-in-aleppo.ashx | title= Rebel counter-attack, storms halt Aleppo offensive |publisher=The Daily Star |agency=AFP |date=19 February 2015 |accessdate=19 February 2015}} A few days later, the rebels launched a counter-offensive, retaking two of four positions they had lost to Syrian government forces.{{cite news|url= https://www.nytimes.com/2015/02/19/world/middleeast/syrian-rebels-regain-territory-near-aleppo.html | title= Syrian Rebels Regain Territory Near Aleppo |publisher=The New York Times |agency= |date=19 February 2015 |accessdate=19 February 2015}} On 9 March, opposition forces launched an assault on Handarat, north of Aleppo, after reportedly noticing confusion in the ranks of Syrian government troops after the February fighting.{{cite news|url=http://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/originals/2015/03/syria-aleppo-handarat-strategic-turkey-opposition-regime.html|title=Rebels advance in Aleppo|first=Mohammed|last=al-Khatieb|publisher=Al Monitor|date=13 March 2015|accessdate=14 March 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150714142919/http://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/originals/2015/03/syria-aleppo-handarat-strategic-turkey-opposition-regime.html|archive-date=14 July 2015|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} Opposition sources said the rebels had captured 40–50% of the village, or possibly even 75%, while the Army remained in control of the northern portion of Handarat.{{cite web|url=http://syriadirect.org/rss/1901-syria-direct-news-update-3-9-15|title=Rebels claim advances in gateway to Aleppo|publisher=syriadirect.org|date=9 March 2015|accessdate=26 January 2017}} In contrast, a Syrian Army source stated they still controlled 80% of Handarat.{{cite web|last=Fadel|first=Leith|url=http://www.almasdarnews.com/article/aleppo-jabhat-al-nusra-forestalled-southern-handarat/|title=Aleppo: Jabhat Al-Nusra Forestalled at southern Handarat|publisher=Al-Masdar|date=11 March 2015|accessdate=26 January 2017}} On 18 March, after almost 10 days of fighting,{{cite web|url=http://syriahr.com/en/2015/03/regime-forces-take-control-on-hendarat-village/|title=Regime forces take control on Hendarat village|work=Syrian Observatory For Human Rights|accessdate=18 March 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150320230117/http://syriahr.com/en/2015/03/regime-forces-take-control-on-hendarat-village/|archivedate=20 March 2015}} the Syrian Army had fully expelled the rebels from Handarat,{{cite news|url=http://www.globalpost.com/dispatch/news/xinhua-news-agency/150318/syrian-troops-fully-recapture-strategic-town|title=Syrian troops fully recapture strategic town|work=GlobalPost|accessdate=18 March 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150318131848/http://www.globalpost.com/dispatch/news/xinhua-news-agency/150318/syrian-troops-fully-recapture-strategic-town|archivedate=18 March 2015}} and re-established control of the village.{{cite web|url=http://ca.reuters.com/article/topNews/idCAKBN0ME1EN20150318|title=Syrian army takes control of strategic village north of Aleppo|agency=Reuters|date=18 March 2015|accessdate=2 May 2015}} [[File:Jdeideh Jdayde Aleppo Avril 2015.webm|right|thumb|Rebel forces use tunnel bombs under the [[Al-Hatab Square]], in preparation for an assault on government troops in April 2015.]] On 13 April, Islamist opposition forces and [[al-Nusra Front]] renewed their assault on the Air Force Intelligence building, utilizing a tunnel bomb followed by an assault.{{cite news|url=https://www.yahoo.com/news/syria-rebels-shut-aleppo-schools-bloody-regime-raid-170910576.html?ref=gs|title=Blast, fierce clashes rock Syrian regime Aleppo base|last=Gebeily|first=Maya|publisher=Yahoo News|agency=AFP|date=14 April 2015|accessdate=27 January 2017}} Much of the Air Force Intelligence building was reportedly damaged as a result of the tunnel bomb.{{cite news|url=http://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/report-evidence-suggests-syrian-troops-toxic-chemicals-30300274|title=Syria Rebels Attack Government Intelligence Center in Aleppo|last=Mroue|first=Bassem|publisher=abcnews.go.com|agency=Associated Press|date=14 April 2015|accessdate=14 April 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150415180929/http://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/report-evidence-suggests-syrian-troops-toxic-chemicals-30300274|archivedate=15 April 2015}} Between 27–29 April, the FSA and [[Ahrar ash-Sham]] launched an operation in the old city of Aleppo and [[Al-Hatab Square]] in the [[Al-Jdayde]] (Jdeideh) District, which included tunnel bombs{{cite web|format=PDF|last1=Danti|first1=Michael D.|author2=Cheikhmous Ali|author3=Tate Paulette|author4=Kathryn Franklin|author5=Allison Cuneo|author6=LeeAnn Barnes Gordon|author7=David Elitzer|url=http://www.asor-syrianheritage.org/wp-content/uploads/2015/06/ASOR_CHI_Weekly_Report_40r.pdf|title=ASOR Cultural Heritage Initiatives (CHI): Planning for Safeguarding Heritage Sites in Syria and Iraq, Weekly Report 40|publisher=asor-syrianheritage.org|date=12 May 2015|accessdate=26 January 2017}} and the shelling of buildings where soldiers were stationed. The rebels claimed to have killed 76 troops in these operations.{{cite web|url=http://www.worldbulletin.net/news/158522/syrian-oppostion-advance-to-central-aleppo|title=Syrian oppostion advance to central Aleppo|publisher=World Bulletin|date=29 April 2015|accessdate=1 May 2015}} Sahat Al Hatab square and the buildings around it were left devastated as a result of this operation.{{Cite news|url=https://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/afp/2016/12/syria-conflict-aleppo-heritage.html|title=Aleppo's famed Old City left 'unrecognisable' by war|last=AFP|date=2016-12-13|work=Al-Monitor|access-date=2018-04-12|language=en-us}} [[File:Sham Legion launch rockets at YPG positions in Aleppo.png|left|thumb|[[Sham Legion]] [[multiple rocket launcher]] mounted on a [[technical (vehicle)|technical]] launch rockets at [[People's Protection Units|YPG]] positions in Aleppo, 2 October 2015.]] In preparation for a new offensive, the rebels heavily shelled government-held parts of Aleppo, leaving 43 civilians dead and 190 wounded on 15 June.{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2015/06/rebel-shelling-kills-dozens-syria-aleppo-150616085739352.html|title=Rebel shelling kills dozens in Syria's Aleppo|work=Al Jazeera English}} On 17 June, rebel forces captured the western neighborhood of Rashideen from Syrian government forces.{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2015/06/rebel-fighters-advance-syria-aleppo-150618143848943.html|title= Rebel fighters advance in Syria's Aleppo|publisher= Al Jazeera English|date= 18 June 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://www.syriahr.com/en/2015/06/rebel-and-islamic-battalions-take-control-on-al-rashdin-area-in-aleppo/ |title=Rebel and Islamic battalions take control on al-Rashdin area in Aleppo |author=Master |work=Syrian Observatory For Human Rights |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150618000323/http://www.syriahr.com/en/2015/06/rebel-and-islamic-battalions-take-control-on-al-rashdin-area-in-aleppo/ |archivedate=18 June 2015 }} Throughout 19 and 20 June, a new round of rebel shelling killed 19 more civilians.{{cite web|url=http://www.syriahr.com/en/2015/06/shells-kill-9-civilians-in-aleppo-city-clashes-continue-around-the-city/ |title=Shells kill 9 civilians in Aleppo city, clashes continue around the city |author=Master |work=Syrian Observatory For Human Rights |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150621034149/http://www.syriahr.com/en/2015/06/shells-kill-9-civilians-in-aleppo-city-clashes-continue-around-the-city/ |archivedate=21 June 2015 }} In early July, two rebel coalitions launched an [[Aleppo offensive (July 2015)|offensive]] against the government-held western half of the city.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-33373410|title=Syria military resists major rebel assault in Aleppo|work=BBC News}} During five days of fighting, the rebels seized the Scientific Research Center on Aleppo's western outskirts, which was being used as a military barracks. Two rebel attacks on the Jamiyat al-Zahra area were repelled. Government forces launched an unsuccessful counter-attack against the Scientific Research Center.{{cite news |title=Syrian rebels advance in government-held Aleppo |url= https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/jul/04/syrian-rebels-advance-west-government-held-aleppo |newspaper=The Guardian |date=4 July 2015 |accessdate=5 July 2015}}{{cite news|last=Aji|first=Albert|author2=Bassem Mroue|url=https://www.usnews.com/news/world/articles/2015/07/07/militants-attack-government-held-neighborhood-in-north-syria|title=Syrian troops repel militants attack on Aleppo neighborhood|publisher=US News & World Report|agency=Associated Press|date=7 July 2015|accessdate=5 August 2015|dead-url=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150708062752/http://www.usnews.com/news/world/articles/2015/07/07/militants-attack-government-held-neighborhood-in-north-syria|archivedate=8 July 2015}} In mid-October, ISIL captured four rebel-held villages northeast of Aleppo, while the Army seized the Syria-Turkey Free Trade Zone, the al-Ahdath juvenile prison and cement plant.{{cite web|url=http://syriadirect.org/news/jabha-shamiya-commander-blames-%E2%80%98complete-lack-of-coordination%E2%80%99for-aleppo-losses/|title=Jabha Shamiya commander blames 'complete lack of coordination' for Aleppo losses|work=Syria Direct}} Meanwhile, the SAA and Hezbollah launched an offensive south of Aleppo, reporting they had captured {{convert|408|km2|abbr=off}} of territory in one month.{{cite web|url=http://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-and-hezbollah-capture-408-square-kilometers-of-territory-in-southern-aleppo/|title=Syrian Army and Hezbollah Capture 408 Square Kilometers of Territory in Southern Aleppo|author=Leith Fadel|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=17 November 2015}} By late December, reporting that they were in control of 3/4 of the southern Aleppo countryside.{{cite web|url=http://www.almasdarnews.com/article/israeli-army-high-alert-hezbollah-promises-retaliate/|title=Hezbollah, Syrian Army control 3/4 of southern Aleppo after completing phase 2 of the offensive|author=Leith Fadel|work=Al-Masdar News|accessdate=23 December 2015}} By the end of 2015, only 80 doctors were left in eastern, rebel-held part of Aleppo, or only one for 7,000 residents, while only one bakery was left to serve 120,000 people. ===2016: Supply lines cut, surrender, and evacuation=== {{main|Combat operations in 2016 during the Battle of Aleppo|Northern Aleppo offensive (February 2016)|2016 Aleppo campaign|Aleppo offensive (September–October 2016)|Aleppo offensive (October–November 2016)|Aleppo offensive (November–December 2016)}} [[file:Syria- two years of tragedy (8557586198).jpg|left|thumb|Destroyed area in Aleppo]] [[File:Battle of Aleppo twin sieges map.png|380px|thumb|The situation in Aleppo on 20 August 2016, when both the rebels and Syrian government forces besieged each other {{leftlegend|#EDC4BE|[[Syrian Arab Army]] control}} {{leftlegend|#CDEBC9|Opposition control (including [[al-Nusra Front]])}} {{leftlegend|#FFFF00|[[Syrian Democratic Forces|SDF]] control}} {{leftlegend|#B4B2AE|[[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant]] control}} {{leftlegend|#F5B678|Joint [[Syrian Arab Army|SAA]]-[[Syrian Democratic Forces|SDF]] control}} {{leftlegend|olive|Confrontation or unclear situation}}]] By 2016, it was estimated that the population of rebel-held Eastern Aleppo had been reduced to 300,000, while 1.5 million were living in government-held Western Aleppo.{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/aug/08/battles-rage-across-aleppo-as-assad-regime-syria-fights-to-quash-rebels |title=Battles rage across Aleppo as Assad regime fights to quell rebels|author=Kareem Shaheen |date=8 August 2016|work=Guardian}} In early February 2016, Syrian government forces and their allies broke a three-year rebel siege of two Shi'ite towns of [[Nubl]] and [[Al-Zahraa|Zahraa]], cutting off a main insurgent route to nearby Turkey.{{cite web |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-crisis-syria-aleppo-idUSKCN0VC1VQ|title=Syrian army and allies breaks rebel siege of Shi'ite towns: army|author=Laila Bassam|date=4 February 2016|work=Reuters}} On 4 February, the towns of [[Mayer, Syria|Mayer]] and [[Kafr Naya]] were recaptured by government forces.{{cite web |url=http://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-captures-mayir-and-kafr-naya-in-new-northern-aleppo-offensive-map-update/|title=Syrian Army captures Mayir and Kafr Naya in new northern Aleppo offensive - Map update |author=Chris Tomson|date=4 February 2016|work=Al-Masdar News}} On 5 February, the government captured the village of [[Ratyan]], to the northwest of Aleppo.{{cite web|url=http://www.almasdarnews.com/article/syrian-army-hezbollah-capture-the-strategic-village-of-rityan-in-northern-aleppo/|title=Syrian Army, Hezbollah capture the strategic village of Rityan in northern Aleppo|author=Leith Fadel|date=5 February 2016 |work=Al-Masdar News}} On 25 June, the Syrian Army and allied forces began their long-awaited North-west Aleppo offensive.{{Cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/tiger-forces-begin-long-awaited-northern-aleppo-offensive/|title=Syrian Army begins North west Aleppo offensive|work=Al Masdar News|date=25 June 2016}} The ultimate goal of the offensive was to cut off the Castello highway, which would cut off the last supply route for rebels inside the city, thus fully encircling remaining opposition forces. By late July, Syrian government forces had managed to sever the last rebel supply line coming from the north, and completely surrounded Aleppo.{{cite web |url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-mideast-crisis-syria-aleppo-idUKKCN1071FO |title=Syrian army says cut off all supply routes into east Aleppo |website= Reuters|access-date=27 July 2016}} However, within days, the rebels launched a large-scale counterattack south of Aleppo, in an attempt to both open a new supply line into rebel-held parts of the city and cut-off the government-held side. The whole campaign, including both the Army's offensive and subsequent rebel counter-offensive, was seen by both sides as possibly deciding the fate of the entire war.{{cite web|url=http://www.conflict-news.com/articles/battle-for-aleppo-a-rebel-breakthrough-or-bust|title=Battle for Aleppo: A Rebel Breakthrough or Bust|publisher=|accessdate=2 August 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160816083259/http://www.conflict-news.com/articles/battle-for-aleppo-a-rebel-breakthrough-or-bust|archive-date=16 August 2016|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2016/08/syria-war-rebels-vow-intensify-offensive-aleppo-160802152801024.html|title=Syria war: Rebels vow to intensify offensive in Aleppo|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/afp/article-3721346/Syrian-regime-forces-roll-rebel-gains-Aleppo.html|title=Syria regime in Aleppo fightback|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=http://www.rferl.mobi/a/islamic-state-syria-aleppo-siege-change-war/27900375.html|title=Analysis: Why The Battle For Aleppo Could Change The Direction Of The War In Syria|publisher=|accessdate=6 August 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://carnegieendowment.org/2016/07/29/what-rebel-loss-of-aleppo-will-mean-for-syria-pub-64225|title=What the Rebel Loss of Aleppo Will Mean for Syria|first=Aron|last=Lund|publisher=|accessdate=6 August 2016}} After a week of heavy fighting, rebels both inside and outside Aleppo advanced into the Ramouseh neighborhood, linked up and captured it, while also seizing the Al-Ramousah Military Academy. With these advances, the rebels managed to cut the government's supply line into the government-held part of west Aleppo{{cite web|url=http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=49141 |title=Factions meet the fighters of the besieged eastern neighborhoods of Aleppo and shelling and violent raids on the outskirts of the city |first= |last=user4 |publisher= |accessdate=6 August 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161005053229/http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=49141 |archivedate=5 October 2016 |df=dmy }}[http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=49158/ Factions incur regime, the Russians, the Iranians and the Lebanese Hezbollah the biggest spiritual and military loss since 2013] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161005053225/http://www.syriahr.com/en/?p=49158%2F |date=5 October 2016 }}{{cite web|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/world/2016/08/06/syria-rebels-try-break-government-seige-aleppo/88336208/|title=Syria rebels try to break government siege in Aleppo|publisher=}} and announced the Army's siege of rebel-held east Aleppo had been broken.{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/afp/article-3726662/Syria-rebels-key-positions-south-Aleppo-monitor.html|title=Syria rebels claim to have broken Assad regime's siege of Aleppo|publisher=|accessdate=6 August 2016}} However, the new rebel supply line was still under Army artillery fire and being hit by air-strikes, making both sides essentially under siege.{{cite web|url=http://carnegie-mec.org/diwan/64274?lang=en|title=Who Is Laying Siege to Whom in Aleppo?|publisher=}} Since the rebel offensive started, at least 130 civilians had been killed, most by rebel shelling of government-held districts. 500 fighters on both sides also died, mostly rebels.{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/afp/article-3726838/At-500-fighters-killed-week-Aleppo-battle-monitor.html|title=At least 500 fighters killed in a week in Aleppo battle: monitor |publisher=|accessdate=6 August 2016}} However, on 4 September, the Syrian Armed forces recaptured the Technical College, Armament college and artillery college, thus imposing the siege on Aleppo once again. Later that week they recaptured the Ramouseh district and reversed almost all rebel gains made since 30 July. The Syrian Government forces then [[Aleppo offensive (September–October 2016)|started an offensive]] to capture eastern Aleppo on 22 September, taking 15–20% of the rebel-held part of Aleppo. Rebels started [[Aleppo offensive (October–November 2016)|an attack on western Aleppo]] in late October, which failed, with government forces retaking areas in the south-west that they had lost to the rebel's late July offensive. The Syrian Army then [[Aleppo offensive (November–December 2016)|launched an offensive]], aimed at finishing rebel-held Aleppo once and for all, during which they captured the Hanano district, Sakhour district, Jabal Badro district, Bustan al-Basha district, Hellok district, Sheikh Kheder district, Sheikh Fares district Haydariyah district, Ayn al-Tal industrial district and reportedly the research housing south of Jabal Badro. They also captured the Ard' Al Hamra district, reportedly cutting rebel-held territory in Aleppo by 40–45%.{{cite web|url=https://www.almasdarnews.com/article/complete-battlefield-update-east-aleppo-map/|title=Complete battlefield update from east Aleppo: map|first=Leith|last=Fadel|date=28 November 2016|publisher=}} By 13 December 2016, only 5% of the original territory of the city remained in rebel hands.{{cite news|title='It is past time for you to act' to end carnage in Aleppo, UN chief tells emergency Security Council session|publisher=UN News Center|date=13 December 2016|accessdate=15 December 2016|url=https://www.un.org/apps/news/story.asp?NewsID=55789#.WFKG69LNzIU}} A ceasefire was announced and the fighting stopped in order to allow the evacuation of civilians and rebels. The buses were prepared for the evacuation. However, the deal fell apart the next day, when the Syrian Government resumed their intense bombing of eastern Aleppo, with both sides blaming the other for the resumed fighting.{{cite news|title=Syrian Government 'palpably failing' to ensure safety of its people – UN human rights chief|publisher=UN News Center|date=14 December 2016|accessdate=15 December 2016|url=https://www.un.org/apps/news/story.asp?NewsID=55802#.WFKCKtLNzIU}} The deal was revived on 15 December with first convoy of evacuees leaving.{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-crisis-syria-official-idUSKBN1440EQ|title=Syrian official says operation begins to evacuate eastern Aleppo|publisher=Reuters}} The evacuation was however suspended on the next day.{{cite web|url=http://www.cnsnews.com/news/article/latest-syria-suspends-aleppo-evacuations-cites-gunfire|title=The Latest: Russia claims Aleppo evacuations are 'completed'|date=16 December 2016|publisher=|access-date=24 December 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170109181230/http://www.cnsnews.com/news/article/latest-syria-suspends-aleppo-evacuations-cites-gunfire|archive-date=9 January 2017|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} Another deal was reached on 18 December and evacuation resumed later in the day.{{cite web|url=http://timesofoman.com/article/98797/World/Middle-East/Aleppo-evacuation-resumes-after-Syrian-rebels-pro-government-forces-reach-deal|title=Aleppo evacuation resumes after Syrian rebels, pro-government forces reach deal|date=18 December 2016|publisher=Times of Oman}} The evacuation again stalled on 20 December, but resumed on the following day.{{cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/aleppo-evacuation-3000-syria-city-war-pro-assad-leave-stall-for-day-a7489096.html|title=Aleppo: 3,000 to leave destroyed Syrian city after evacuations stalled for a day|date=21 December 2016|publisher=The Independent}}{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/idUSKBN14A1CL|title=Aleppo evacuation resumes after day-long hold-up|date=21 December 2016|publisher=Reuters}} On 22 December, the evacuation was completed while the Syrian Army declared it had taken complete control of the city.{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/idUSKBN14B1NQ|title=Syrian army announces victory in Aleppo in boost for Assad|date=22 December 2016|publisher=Reuters}} Red Cross later confirmed that the evacuation of all civilians and rebels was complete.{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/idUSKBN14B1NQ|title=Aleppo evacuation is complete, Red Cross says|date=22 December 2016|publisher=Reuters}} In the closing days of the battle for the city, the [[Times of Israel]] reported that "Testimonies emerging from the city since Monday detail brutal atrocities being committed by pro-government Syrian forces.{{cite web|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/war-crimes-in-aleppo-while-the-us-stands-idly-by/|title=Assad and allies commit war crimes in Aleppo, while US stands idly by|publisher=}} ==Aftermath== On 22 February 2018, it was reported that the [[YPG]] had agreed to hand over eastern districts of Aleppo city to the Syrian government. According to Syrian state television, this decision was made to reinforce positions around the [[Afrin Region|region of Afrin]], and to halt [[Turkish military operation in Afrin|Turkey's offensive]].{{Cite news|url=http://www.plenglish.com/index.php?o=rn&id=24863&SEO=kurdish-militia-ypg-to-deliver-syrian-army-neighborhoods-in-aleppo|title=Kurdish Militia YPG to Hand Over Syrian Army Neighborhoods in Aleppo|work=prensa-latina.cu|access-date=22 February 2018|language=es-ES}} This came days after pro-Syrian regime fighters agreed to bolster the Kurdish forces in the northwest.{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-43131600|title=Syrian pro-government forces enter Afrin|date=20 February 2018|work=BBC News|access-date=22 February 2018|language=en-GB}} SOHR and a witness later said that Syrian government forces had entered the areas controlled by the Kurdish fighters. [[YPG]] spokesman Nouri Mahmoud however denied this claim.{{Cite news|url=https://www.usnews.com/news/world/articles/2018-02-22/syrian-government-forces-enter-kurdish-held-aleppo-area-witness|title=Syrian Kurdish YPG Denies Government Entered Kurdish-Held Aleppo District|date=22 February 2018|work=Reuters|publisher=U.S. News & World Report|access-date=23 February 2018}} A [[YPG]] commander later stated that Kurdish fighters had shifted to [[Afrin, Syria|Afrin]] to help repel a Turkish assault. As a result, he said the pro-Syrian government forces had regained control of the districts previously controlled by them.{{Cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-crisis-syria-militia/syrian-ypg-militia-government-has-taken-control-of-aleppo-district-idUSKCN1G62K9|title=Syrian YPG militia: government has taken control of Aleppo district|website=Reuters}} == Strategic analysis == [[File:Rif Aleppo2.svg|thumb|right|300px|The situation after the Battle of Aleppo {{leftlegend|#EDC4BE|[[Syrian Arab Army]] control}} {{leftlegend|#CDEBC9|Opposition control (including [[al-Nusra Front]])}} {{leftlegend|#FFFF00|[[Syrian Democratic Forces|SDF]] control}} {{leftlegend|#F5B678|Joint [[Syrian Arab Army|SAA]]-[[Syrian Democratic Forces|SDF]] control}} {{leftlegend|olive|Confrontation or unclear situation}}]] Rebel forces expanded into the countryside south of Aleppo to control sections of the M4 and M5 highways, effectively blocking ground reinforcements for the Syrian Army. Before the end of 2012, the Syrian Army in Aleppo was receiving sporadic supplies and ammunition replenishment by air or via backroads.{{cite web|title=Syria rebels win support from Britain, battle in Damascus|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/11/20/us-syria-crisis-idUSBRE88J0X720121120|publisher=Reuters|accessdate=27 September 2015}} The fall of Base 46, a large complex that reinforced and supplied government troops, was seen by experts as "a tactical turning point that may lead to a strategic shift" in the battle for Aleppo.{{cite web|title=AP Exclusive: Syrian rebels seize base, arms trove|url=https://news.yahoo.com/ap-exclusive-syrian-rebels-seize-arms-trove-202610902.html|publisher=Yahoo|accessdate=27 September 2015}} In a November 2012, intelligence report, American publisher [[Stratfor|Strategic Forecasting, Inc.]] described the strategic position of government forces in Aleppo as "dire", and said the Free Syrian Army had them "essentially surrounded".{{cite web|title=Recent Rebel Gains in Syria|url=https://www.stratfor.com/sample/analysis/recent-rebel-gains-syria|publisher=Stratfor|accessdate=27 September 2015}} On 26 November 2012, rebels captured [[Tishrin Dam]], further isolating government forces in Aleppo and leaving only one route into Aleppo.{{cite web|url=http://blogs.voanews.com/breaking-news/2012/11/26/syrian-rebels-seize-major-dam-in-north/ |title=Syrian Rebels Seize Major Dam in North " VOA Breaking News |publisher=Blogs.voanews.com |date=26 November 2012 |accessdate=29 August 2013}} By late January 2013 Deputy Prime Minister [[Qadri Jamil]] said all supply routes to Aleppo had been cut off by opposition forces, comparing the situation to the [[Siege of Leningrad]].{{cite web|url=http://english.ruvr.ru/2013_01_29/Aleppo-like-Leningrad-under-siege-Syrian-Dep-PM/|title=Aleppo like Leningrad under siege – Syrian Dep. PM|publisher=RIA|date=29 January 2012|accessdate=29 January 2012}} By late February 2013, [[Aleppo International Airport]] was almost surrounded by rebel forces.{{cite web|last=Surk |first=Barbara |url=http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2013/feb/23/battle-syrias-aleppo-airport-intensifies/ |title=Battle for Syria's Aleppo airport intensifies |publisher=Washington Times |date=23 February 2013 |accessdate=6 July 2013}}
{{cite web|url=http://www.ndtv.com/article/world/syria-rebels-seize-key-checkpoint-near-aleppo-airport-ngo-332405 |title=Syria rebels seize key checkpoint near Aleppo airport: NGO |publisher=NDTV.com |date=18 February 2013 |accessdate=6 July 2013}}
{{cite web|url=http://www.dailystar.com.lb/News/Middle-East/2013/Feb-18/206927-syria-rebels-seize-key-checkpoint-near-aleppo-airport-activists.ashx#axzz2MhLzu4oB |title=Syrian rebels push offensive for major airport|publisher=The Daily Star |date=|accessdate=6 July 2013}} Later, the Syrian Army regained control of the strategic town Tel Sheigeb, allowing them to approach the airport.{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2013/03/201332145439859542.html |title=Syria army seizes key Aleppo airport road|publisher=Al Jazeera|date=3 March 2013|accessdate=6 July 2013}}
{{cite news|last=Evans |first=Dominic |url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2013/03/01/uk-syria-crisis-idUKBRE92013C20130301 |title=Assad forces take Aleppo village, reopening supply line|agency=Reuters|date=1 March 2013 |accessdate=6 July 2013}} In November 2013, the Syrian Army retook the town of al-Safira.{{cite news|first=Erika|last=Solomon |title=Syrian army captures strategic town at approaches to Aleppo |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2013/11/01/us-syria-crisis-safira-idUSBRE9A00LO20131101 |agency=Reuters |date=1 November 2013 |accessdate=2 November 2013}} This opened a road for the government to support the besieged Kuweires Military Airbase and Aleppo Power Plant. In February 2014, it was reported that the army planned to encircle Aleppo and impose blockades and truces. It would also try to recapture [[Shaykh Najjar|Sheikh Najjar Industrial City]] to rebuild the economy and provide jobs.{{cite web|first=Alaa|last=Halabi|url=http://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/security/2014/03/syria-army-impose-blockade-militants-aleppo.html#|title=Syrian army to impose blockade in Aleppo|publisher=Al-Monitor|date=5 March 2014|accessdate=24 October 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150713202354/http://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/security/2014/03/syria-army-impose-blockade-militants-aleppo.html|archive-date=13 July 2015|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} By October 2014, the army had seized Sheikh Najjar, reinforced Aleppo Central Prison and captured Handaraat, almost besieging rebel-held Aleppo. Tensions peaked in early April 2014, when a Syrian Republican Guard officer allegedly killed a Hezbollah commander during an argument over the opposition advance in al-Rashadin,{{cite news|title=Tensions Grow Between Hezbollah and the Syrian Regime|url=http://www.stratfor.com/sample/analysis/tensions-grow-between-hezbollah-and-syrian-regime |work=Stratfor |date=23 April 2014 |accessdate=25 April 2014}} and other pro-government militia groups sent as reinforcements, such as the [[National Defence Forces (Syria)|National Defence Force]], proved to be unreliable in combat.{{cite web|first=Jack|last=Mulcaire|url=http://nationalinterest.org/blog/the-buzz/aleppo-syrias-stalingrad-10290|title=Aleppo: Syria's Stalingrad?|publisher=The National Interest|date=22 April 2014|accessdate=10 May 2014}}{{cite web|url=http://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/originals/2014/04/syria-aleppo-offensive-rebels-jabhat-nusra-regime.html#|title=West Aleppo faces unending assault|publisher=Al-Monitor|accessdate=17 April 2014}} Effectively cutting off access was more difficult in Aleppo because rebels controlled more terrain there than in other cities. Rebels also have a strong presence in the countryside and around the border crossings with Turkey.{{cite news|last=Caris|first=Charlie|title=The Siege of Aleppo?|url=http://iswresearch.blogspot.com.au/2014/03/the-siege-of-aleppo.html|work=Institute for the Study of War|date=18 March 2014|accessdate=26 January 2017}} In April 2014 government commanders inside the city were saying that contrary to implementing such a strategy, "the best [they] can do in Aleppo is just secure ... positions".{{cite news|title=Aleppo Now A De Facto 'Partition City' In Syria|url=https://www.npr.org/2014/04/27/307473375/aleppo-now-a-de-facto-partition-city-in-syria |work=NPR |date=28 April 2014 |accessdate=28 April 2014}} The attempted encirclement involved the SAA's attacks on Bustan Al-Pasha, Khalidiyyeh, the farms of Mazra'a Halabi, Al-Amariyya and Bustan Al-Qaseer.{{cite web|url=http://www.almasdarnews.com/article/aleppo-battle-map-saa-prepares-envelop-city/|title=Aleppo Battle Map: SAA Prepares to Envelop the City|first=Leith|last=Fadel|publisher=Al-Masdar News|date=5 November 2014|accessdate=26 January 2017}} The rebels' strategic victory at the [[Siege of Wadi Deif]] resulted in threats to several main government supply lines.{{cite news|url=http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/7112a006-844d-11e4-8cc5-00144feabdc0.html |title=Assad army bases fall to al-Qaeda allies |publisher=Financial Times|first=Ericka |last=Soloman |date=16 December 2014 |accessdate=22 December 2014}} This cast doubt on government forces' ambitions to control the road from Hama to Aleppo and the Damascus-Aleppo international road, and has been seen as a personal defeat for Syrian Arab Army Col. [[Suheil Al Hassan]].{{cite news |url=http://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/originals/2014/12/syria-idlib-jabhat-al-nusra-control-loss-regime.html |title=Jabhat al-Nusra deals Syrian regime major blow in Idlib |publisher=Al-Monitor |first=Mustafa |last=al-Haj |date=19 December 2014 |accessdate=21 December 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141220141703/http://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/originals/2014/12/syria-idlib-jabhat-al-nusra-control-loss-regime.html |archivedate=20 December 2014 |df=dmy-all }} [[Staffan de Mistura]], the United Nations and Arab League Envoy to Syria, proposed a pause in fighting, but opinions about implementation were divided.{{cite news|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2014/12/un-aleppo-ceasefire-plan-hangs-balance-20141220112425305410.html |title= UN's Aleppo ceasefire plan hangs in balance |publisher=Al Jazeera |date=21 December 2014 |accessdate=22 December 2014}} The European Union warned that "cases of forced surrender imposed by the Assad regime through starvation sieges were labelled fallaciously as local cease-fires in the past."{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-30476609|title=Syria conflict: Rebels capture key Idlib army bases|publisher=BBC News|date=15 December 2014|accessdate=22 December 2014}} The [[Southern Front (Syrian rebel group)|Southern Front of the Free Syrian Army]], which was gaining ground in Deraa province south of Damascus, warned that a freeze in fighting in Aleppo could hamper their advance, as pro-Assad forces could be redirected from Aleppo.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-30374581 |title=Syria war: Southern rebels see US as key to success |publisher=BBC News |first=Kim |last=Ghattas |date=9 December 2014 |accessdate=22 December 2014}} The Syrian government's defeat at the [[Second Battle of Idlib]] in late March 2015, which helped expand the influence of the al-Nusra Front, forced the Islamic State ([[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant|IS]]) to expand its attacks in central Syria after it failed to block the Raqqa highway that branches out to the Syrian army's main supply route to Aleppo along the Khanasir-Athriya road. IS's aim would potentially be to establish the necessary conditions to attack Idlib and al-Nusra.{{cite web|url=http://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/security/2015/04/syria-hama-is-nusra-attack-aleppo-army.html |title=IS' Hama incursion threatens Nusra's gains |publisher=Al Monitor |date=2 April 2015 |accessdate=2 April 2015}} The [[Hama and Homs offensive (March–April 2015)|March–April IS offensive]] in central Syria led some volunteers defending the Homs-Aleppo highway to consider deserting to defend their hometowns.{{cite news|last1=Barnard|first1=Anne|author2=Hwaida Saad|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/04/02/world/middleeast/syria-isis-advances-in-hama-and-damascus.html|title=ISIS Said to Step Up Offensive in Syria|publisher=The New York Times|date=1 April 2015|accessdate=26 January 2017}} According to [[Jane's Information Group]], a possible offensive on Homs by both al-Nusra Front and IS working independently might force the government to move critical forces away from Aleppo to defend key supply routes.{{cite news|url=http://www.janes.com/article/50598/jabhat-al-nusra-and-islamic-state-s-attempts-at-cutting-damascus-homs-highway-would-threaten-assad-s-control-of-syria|title=Jabhat al-Nusra and Islamic State's attempts at cutting Damascus-Homs highway would threaten Assad's control of Syria|last=Abi Ali|first=Firas|publisher=IHS Jane's 360|date=12 April 2015|accessdate=15 April 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150416004356/http://www.janes.com/article/50598/jabhat-al-nusra-and-islamic-state-s-attempts-at-cutting-damascus-homs-highway-would-threaten-assad-s-control-of-syria|archivedate=16 April 2015}} There were additional opposition gains during the [[2015 Jisr al-Shughur offensive]].{{cite news|url=http://www.janes.com/article/51012/syrian-opposition-success-in-idlib-province-likely-to-threaten-aleppo-latakia-and-assad-s-hold-on-power|title=Syrian opposition success in Idlib province likely to threaten Aleppo, Latakia, and Assad's hold on power|publisher=IHS Jane's 360|last=Abi Ali|first=Firas|date=27 April 2015|accessdate=29 April 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150520010933/http://www.janes.com/article/51012/syrian-opposition-success-in-idlib-province-likely-to-threaten-aleppo-latakia-and-assad-s-hold-on-power|archivedate=20 May 2015|quote=Aleppo has been reduced to symbolic importance ... The government is no longer able to reinforce its positions in Aleppo. As such, it cannot prevent its fall should the Islamist opposition or the Islamic State launch a major offensive against it ... It would also increase the incentive for Alawite fighters and officers to abandon locations such as Aleppo and southern Syria and retreat to defend their home towns.}} Syrian government minister Faisal Mekdad stated in June 2015, "All our strategic planning now is to keep the way open to Aleppo to allow our forces to defend it".{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/syrian-civil-war-can-assads-regime-survive-the-onslaught-from-isis-and-jabhat-alnusra-10317350.html |title=Syrian civil war: Can Assad's regime survive the onslaught from Isis and Jabhat al-Nusra?|publisher=The Independent |last1=Fisk |first1=Robert |date=12 June 2015 |accessdate= 13 June 2015}} Media outlets have noted that powerful online campaigns are being conducted in a war of information regarding Aleppo. === The role of Turkey === Turkey had sponsored rebel forces in Aleppo to a degree that eastern Aleppo was called "a Turkish card guarded by jihadis."{{cite news|author=Robert F. Worth|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/05/24/magazine/aleppo-after-the-fall.html|title=Aleppo After the Fall|publisher=New York Times Magazine|date=24 May 2017}} However, Turkish policy changed in August 2016, moving thousands of rebel fighters away from the area west of Aleppo to counter the secular federalist [[Syrian Democratic Forces]] to the north (''see [[Turkish military intervention in Syria (August 2016 – March 2017)|Turkish military intervention in Syria]]''). This reduced the forces available to try to lift the siege of Aleppo, ensuring its fall.{{cite news|last=Sayigh|first=Yezid|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-38473702|title=Ceasefire in Syria: Turkish policy sets Syria on new path|publisher=BBC News|date=30 December 2016|accessdate=26 January 2017}} ==Casualties== [[File:Syria- two years of tragedy (8642756918).jpg|thumb|Aleppo, Karm al Jabal neighborhood, 2013]] With over four years of fighting, the battle of Aleppo represents one of the [[List of sieges|longest sieges]] in modern warfare, which left an estimated 31,183 people dead, almost a tenth of the overall Syrian war casualties. The [[Violations Documentation Center in Syria]] assessed the death toll. According to its records, between 19 July 2012 and 15 December 2016 there were 22,633 adult male deaths (73%), 2,849 adult female deaths (9.2%), 3,773 child male deaths (12.2%) and 1,775 child female deaths (5.7%). 23,604 or 76% of all fatalities were civilians, while only 7,406 or 24% were military deaths. Causes of death were explosions (910 deaths), shelling (6,384 deaths), [[summary execution|field execution]] (1,549 deaths), [[shooting]] (9,438 deaths), warplane bombardment (11,233 deaths), chemical and toxic gas attacks (46 deaths) and others. The pro-opposition monitoring group the [[Syrian Observatory for Human Rights]] (SOHR) gave a similar number: it registered that 1,612 days of fighting for Aleppo left 21,452 civilians dead. Among them were 5,261 children under the age of 18 and 2,777 women over the age of 18. The [[Syrian Network for Human Rights]] (SNHR), a pro-opposition non-governmental organization, reported that the Russian bombardments killed at least 1,640 civilians in the Aleppo area: 1,178 civilians died between 30 September 2015 and 1 August 2016,{{cite web |title=2704 Civilians, including 746 Children, have been killed by the Russian Forces | url=http://sn4hr.org/wp-content/pdf/english/2704_civilians_killed_by_Russian_forces_en.pdf | page=4 |date=17 August 2016| publisher=Syrian Network for Human Rights |accessdate= 1 January 2017 }} while additional 462 civilians were killed from 19 September 2016 until 30 November 2016.{{cite web |title=UN has to Ensure the Safety and Fate of IDPs from Aleppo's Eastern Neighborhoods | url=http://sn4hr.org/blog/2016/11/30/29832/ |date=30 November 2016| publisher=[[Syrian Network for Human Rights]] |accessdate= 1 January 2017 }} [[The International Committee of the Red Cross]] (ICRC) has described the fighting as one of the most devastating conflicts in modern times. It appealed: "The human cost of the fighting in Aleppo is simply too high. We urge all parties to stop the destruction and indiscriminate attacks, and stop the killing".{{cite web | url=https://www.icrc.org/en/document/syria-news-cities-aleppo-one-most-devastating-urban-conflicts |title=Syria: Aleppo "One of the most devastating urban conflicts in modern times" |publisher=[[The International Committee of the Red Cross]]|date= 15 August 2016 |accessdate= 15 December 2016 }} The ICRC also said that hundreds of civilians perished through the "indiscriminate shelling of residential areas across Aleppo".{{cite web | title=Syria: Aleppo civilians under attack |url=https://www.icrc.org/eng/resources/documents/news-release/2014/04-22-syria-damascus-aleppo-violence-civilians.htm|publisher=[[The International Committee of the Red Cross]]|date= 22 April 2014 |accessdate= 15 December 2016 }} Several infectious diseases broke out in Aleppo and other areas in Syria during the civil war, including [[poliomyelitis]], [[measles]] and [[cutaneous leishmaniasis]].{{cite journal|last=Sharara|first=Sima L.|author2=Souha S. Kanj|title=War and Infectious Diseases: Challenges of the Syrian Civil War|journal=PLoS Pathogens|publisher=Public Library of Science (PLoS)|volume=10|issue=11|date=13 November 2014|page=e1004438|url=https://doi.org/10.1371%2Fjournal.ppat.1004438|doi=10.1371/journal.ppat.1004438|accessdate=26 January 2017}} Food prices also grew astronomically during the war. A kilogram (two pounds) of [[sugar]] cost $21 at one point.{{cite web | title=Aleppo: Around 20,000 flee their homes over past three days |url=https://www.icrc.org/en/document/aleppo-war-civilians-flee|publisher=The International Committee of the Red Cross|date= 29 November 2016 |accessdate= 20 December 2016 }} ==Allegations of war crimes== ===Syrian government and allies=== {{Quote box|width=20%|align=right|quote=The violations and abuses suffered by people across the country, including the siege and bombardment of eastern Aleppo, are not simply tragedies; they also constitute crimes of historic proportions.|source=[[UN High Commissioner for Human Rights]], [[Zeid Ra'ad Al Hussein]]{{cite web|url=http://ohchr.org/EN/NewsEvents/Pages/HRCTacklesAleppoCrisis.aspx|title=Zeid tells Council siege and bombardment of Aleppo "constitute crimes of historic proportions" |date=21 October 2016|author=Zeid Ra'ad Al Hussein|accessdate=14 December 2016|publisher=[[OHCHR]]}}}} Aleppo suffered catastrophic damage during the four-year siege and battle. According to an [[Amnesty International]] report, government forces have been responsible for the majority of violations in the conflict in Syria. Ravina Shamdasani, a spokesperson for the Office of the [[UN High Commissioner for Human Rights]], issued a statement in November 2016 which said that "strikes against [[hospital]]s, [[school]]s, [[marketplace]]s, water facilities and [[bakeries]] are now commonplace, and may amount to [[war crimes]]". During that phase of the offensive, about 250,000 civilians were left in the city.{{cite web|url=https://www.un.org/apps/news/story.asp?NewsID=55447#.WFFHk9LNzIU|title=UN rights office concerned at continuing hostilities in both western and eastern Aleppo |date=1 November 2016|author=|accessdate=14 December 2016|publisher=UN News Center}} In November 2016, [[UNICEF]] estimated that nearly 100,000 children were living under siege in Aleppo.{{cite web|url=https://www.un.org/apps/news/story.asp?NewsID=55657#.WFFNAdLNzIU|title=With 500,000 children living under siege in Syria, UNICEF calls for humanitarian access |date=28 November 2016|author=|accessdate=14 December 2016|publisher=UN News Center}} The 2016 offensive cut off the city from food supplies, and last time eastern Aleppo was reached with significant [[Humanitarian aid|humanitarian supplies]] before the Syrian re-capture was the beginning of July in 2016.{{cite web|url=https://www.un.org/apps/news/story.asp?NewsID=55526#.WFFJStLNzIU|title=Syria: UN envoy urges action to avert mass hunger in eastern Aleppo ahead of 'killer' winter |date=10 November 2016|author=|accessdate=14 December 2016|publisher=UN News Center}} The Syrian government, aided by Russian army, used war planes to systematically bombard hospitals in the rebel-held areas of the city.{{cite web|url=https://www.un.org/apps/news/story.asp?NewsID=55580#.WFFLqNLNzIU|title=UN health agency denounces attacks on health facilities in Syria |date=17 November 2016|author=|accessdate=14 December 2016|publisher=UN News Center}}{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2016/10/syria-war-aleppo-hospital-bombed-time-161001135413643.html|title=Syria war: Aleppo hospital bombed for second time |date=1 October 2016|author=|accessdate=14 December 2016|publisher=[[Al Jazeera]]}} By the end of November 2016, no functional hospitals were left, and over 20,000 people were displaced by the fighting.{{cite web|url=https://www.un.org/apps/news/story.asp?NewsID=55665#.WFFNs9LNzIU|title=Syria: Amid 'chilling' situation in Aleppo, 16,000 flee intense fighting, UN aid chief warns |date=29 November 2016|author=|accessdate=14 December 2016|publisher=UN News Center}} [[Human Rights Watch]] issued a statement reporting that the Syrian and Russian military campaign killed more than 440 civilians, including more than 90 children, between September and October 2016. It also deplored that airstrikes often appeared to be "recklessly indiscriminate".{{cite web|url=https://www.hrw.org/news/2016/12/01/russia/syria-war-crimes-month-bombing-aleppo|title=Russia/Syria: War Crimes in Month of Bombing Aleppo |date=1 December 2016|author=|accessdate=14 December 2016|publisher=Human Rights Watch}} Between 29 January and 14 March 2013, opposition activists reported about 230 bodies were found on the banks and in the [[Queiq River]] in Aleppo. They accused government forces of being the ones who executed the men since the bodies came down the river from the direction of government-held areas of the city. [[Human Rights Watch]] was able to identify at least 147 victims, all male and aged between 11 and 64.{{cite web|url=http://www.news24.com/World/News/Bodies-in-Syria-river-likely-killed-in-govt-areas-20130604-2|title=Bodies in Syria river likely killed in govt areas|work=News24|accessdate=27 October 2014}} [[Human Rights Watch]] reported that family members of many of the victims testified that they were last seen in a government-controlled area or after they set out to cross into the area through two checkpoints, one manned by opposition forces and the other by government forces.{{cite web|url=https://www.hrw.org/news/2013/06/04/syria-stream-bodies-aleppo-s-river |title=Syria: A Stream of Bodies in Aleppo's River | Human Rights Watch |publisher=Hrw.org |date=2013-06-04 |accessdate=2014-08-24}}{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/interactive/2013/mar/11/syria-bodies-river-aleppo-massacre |title=Syria: the story behind one of the most shocking images of the war | World news |publisher=The Guardian |date=2013-03-10 |accessdate=2014-08-24 |location=London |first1=Martin |last1=Chulov |first2=Mustafa |last2=Khalili |first3=Noah |last3=Payne-Frank}} In May 2014, the [[UN Security Council]] voted for the [[International Criminal Court]] (ICC) to investigate war crimes in the Syrian Civil War, but the resolution was vetoed by Russia and China.{{cite web |title=Russia, China block Security Council referral of Syria to International Criminal Court|url=https://www.un.org/apps/news/story.asp?NewsID=47860#.WFGTvNLNzIU|publisher=UN News Center|date=22 May 2014|accessdate=14 December 2016}} In 2014, the [[United Nations]] adopted Resolution 2139 which ordered the end of using [[barrel bomb]]s in the battle.{{cite web|title='There are no barrel bombs': Assad's Syria 'facts' |url= http://www.channel4.com/news/assad-syria-interview-bbc-barrel-bombs-facts-video |publisher=Channel4 |accessdate=24 September 2015}} The Syrian Observatory of Human Rights stated that the Syrian army dropped 7,000 barrel bombs in the first five months of 2015, claiming the lives of 3,000 people. [[Amnesty International]] reported that barrel bombs killed 3,000 people in 2014.{{cite web|title=Syria's 'Circle of hell': Barrel bombs in Aleppo bring terror and bloodshed forcing civilians underground|url=https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/news/2015/05/syrias-circle-of-hell-barrel-bombs-in-aleppo/|publisher=Amnesty international| date=5 May 2015|accessdate=24 September 2015}} ''[[Channel4]]'' reported that videos have emerged online showing the Syrian army using barrel bombs. The Syrian government was accused of using the barrel bombs many times. Some of them were: * ''[[Middle East Monitor]]'' reported 14 deaths allegedly caused by the bombs in the Kallasa and Qasila neighbourhood of the city in June 2015.{{cite web|title=At least 14 killed in Aleppo barrel-bomb attack |url=https://www.middleeastmonitor.com/news/middle-east/19362-at-least-14-killed-in-aleppo-barrel-bomb-attack |publisher=Middle East Monitor|accessdate=24 September 2015}} * [[CNN-IBN]] wrote about the government dropping barrel bombs in July in the neighbourhood of al-Bab causing the death of 35 and injuring 50 others.{{cite web|title=Syria: Assad regime barrel bombs kill at least 35 people in Aleppo|url=http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/syria-assad-regime-barrel-bombs-kill-least-35-people-aleppo-1510679 |publisher=IBN Times|accessdate=24 September 2015}} * [[BBC News]] alleged the government dropped the bombs in May, leading to the death of 72 civilians.{{cite web|title=Syria crisis: 'Barrel bomb strikes kill 72' in Aleppo province|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-32942090|publisher=BBC|accessdate=24 September 2015}} * The [[Anadolu Agency]] of Turkey wrote that the bombs launched by the government forces in July killed 15 people.{{cite web|title=Barrel-bomb attacks kill 15 in Aleppo|url=http://www.aa.com.tr/en/world/barrel-bomb-attacks-kill-15-in-aleppo/30505|publisher=Anadolu Agency|accessdate=24 September 2015}} * According to the ''Violations Documentation Center'', barrel bomb attacks peaked between April and July 2014, with an average of 107 attacks per month, and decreased to an average of around 17 per month from September 2014 to March 2015. The government denied using barrel bombs.{{cite web|title='Barrel-bomb attack' targets mosque in Syria's Aleppo|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2015/06/barrel-bomb-attacks-syria-aleppo-reported-150622175005995.html |publisher=Al Jazeera|accessdate=24 September 2015}} In an interview to BBC, President Bashar al-Assad denied using "indiscriminate weapons" like barrel bombs in the rebel held territories.{{cite web|title=Syria conflict: President Assad on weapons of war|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-31327152 |publisher=BBC|accessdate=24 September 2015}} Assad said, "I know about the army. They use bullets, missiles and bombs. I haven't heard of the army using barrels, or maybe cooking pots."{{cite web |title=If You Kill the People They'll Be Against You|url=https://newrepublic.com/article/121066/bashar-al-assad-interview-syrian-army-doesnt-use-barrel-bombs|publisher=New Republic|accessdate=24 September 2015}} Amnesty International issued a detailed report about Aleppo in 2015. It warned about the Syrian government use of imprecise explosive weapons on densely populated civilian areas, illustrating it with the example that eight barrel bomb attacks between January 2014 to March 2015 killed at least 188 civilians—while only one rebel was recorded among the fatalities.{{cite web |title="Death Everywhere": War Crimes and Human Rights Abuses in Aleppo| format=PDF| url=http://www.amnestyusa.org/sites/default/files/embargoed_5_may_aleppo_report_death_everywhere.pdf| pages=7, 15 | date=May 2015| publisher=Amnesty International| accessdate=20 December 2016}} It concluded that the government forces in Aleppo deliberately targeted civilians and civilian objects, implemented "[[forced disappearance]]s", used [[torture]] and other ill-treatment among the prisoners—and that this constitutes a [[crime against humanity]]. [[Chemical attack]]s by the Syrian government on opposition-held areas in Aleppo were reported on 10 August{{cite web |title=Syria: Fresh chemical attack on Aleppo a war crime|url=https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/news/2016/08/syria-fresh-chemical-attack-on-aleppo-a-war-crime/|publisher=Amnesty International|date=11 August 2016|accessdate=14 December 2016}} and 6 September 2016. After these attacks, the victims reported they were suffering from a shortage of breath, coughing, reddened skin and eyes, and excessive tearing, and sought medical treatment in hospitals. Five people, including three children, died as a result.{{cite web |title=Syria: New Deadly Chemical Attacks|url=https://www.hrw.org/news/2016/09/28/syria-new-deadly-chemical-attacks|publisher=Human Rights Watch|date=28 September 2016|accessdate=14 December 2016}} A UN report found that the Syrian government used the prohibited [[chlorine bombs]] in Aleppo, causing "hundreds of civilian casualties".
